intro: Lefebvrea abyssinica var. angustisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lefebvrea, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It features slender, upright stems with lanceolate leaves that are finely serrated along the edges. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The species is characterized by its adapted morphology to thrive in high-altitude, arid environments.
